text.p: Following are some of the leading stories in Norwegian papers this morning:

-Immigrants from non-western countries have lower income and lower living standards than Norwegians in general. Thirty percent of immigrant families receive salaries that are below EU's minimum income levels, a study shows.

-The Polish crew on board the Leros Strength bulk carrier reported to family members already last Wednesday that there was water in a cargo hold. The ship sank on Saturday off Norway with all 20 sailors.
-An increasing number of Norwegians buy services at private hospitals. However profits have fallen considerably in the last year for most private hospitals.
-Finance minister Jens Stoltenberg wants more efficient laws for share and bond markets. A new law will be introduced to parliament this spring.
-Norway's oil and gas recoverable reserves continue to be upgraded. Over the last two years reserve estimates have been upgraded by 15 percent.

-Manager Einar Forsbak at Norway's Union Bank Association sees no need for a merger between Norway's two largest commercial banks. Leading bankers have suggested to merge Christiania Bank and Den Norske Bank in order to meet increased competition.
